title: Čuma
text:
Čuma or kuga () is the <a href="personification">personification</a> of <a href="plague%20%28disease%29">plague</a> in <a href="Serbian%20mythology">Serbian mythology</a>. It was imagined as an old (rarely, as young) <a href="woman">woman</a> dressed in <a href="white">white</a>. Mentioning čuma was avoided, so <a href="euphemism">euphemism</a>s "kuma" (godmother) or "teta" (aunty) () were used.
Čumas were believed to live in a far away land, from where they set out to infect people. They hate <a href="dirt">dirt</a>iness and are especially eager to infect a dirty house, hence if plague would appear in the vicinity, it was believed that every house and its occupants must be thoroughly cleaned; which was a useful belief that actually helps with real plague. <a href="Sacrifice">Offerings</a> of food, clean water, <a href="basil">basil</a> and a comb could also be made to her.
